Read more here. ⤵ https://www.wicker.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/wicker-hyde-smith-palazzo-announce-2-0m-grant-for-usm-marine-research-center …

The policies included in the #NDAA will help our military to counter growing and evolving threats worldwide and support the industrial base and military families at home. https://www.wicker.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/wicker-votes-for-defense-authorization-bill …

The #NDAA bill the Senate passed today increases funding for our military to undo the damage of sequestration, continues the push to a 355-ship Navy to defend our interests around the globe, and provides our troops a well-deserved pay raise.  https://www.wicker.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/wicker-votes-for-defense-authorization-bill …

Today I voted for the National Defense Authorization Act. The #NDAA is a vitally important bill because there is no greater responsibility than to provide for the national defense of our country.  https://www.wicker.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/wicker-votes-for-defense-authorization-bill …

Today I introduced the #RuralJobsAct to fight poverty and create jobs in some of the poorest rural communities in America. Read more about the proposal here ⤵ https://www.wicker.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/wicker-colleagues-introduce-rural-jobs-act-to-fight-rural-poverty-create-jobs …

Today the Senate passed legislation to address the humanitarian crisis at the border. This funding would help our border patrol agents & other federal employees provide necessities & better conditions for children in U.S. care and enhance border security. https://www.wicker.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/wicker-votes-to-address-humanitarian-crisis-at-the-border …

Today I spoke from the Senate floor in support of the National Defense Authorization Act. The #NDAA would build on progress that has been made to recover from the disastrous effects of budget sequestration under the last administration. https://www.wicker.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/wicker-urges-passage-of-national-defense-bill …

Our soldiers and suppliers need long-term certainty and the tools necessary to fulfill their missions. It is time for Congress to do its job and give our troops the tools they need to keep us safe. #NDAA

If nothing changes, automatic cuts will take effect early next year. While it is important for the federal government to control spending, cuts should not be made on the backs our men and women in uniform. #NDAA

“The worst part about [continuing resolutions] for us is the unpredictability… So at best, you try to hold your head above water with what you’ve got, but what really happens is an erosion of readiness.” – @USMC Lt. Gen. Berger to @SASCMajority https://youtu.be/or7yjHrpQq8?t=287 …

"A continuing resolution would be devastating to the @USArmy …Readiness would be reversed…Modernization would halt…The quality of life of our soldiers would be seriously impacted if we went back.” - U.S. Army Gen. James McConville https://twitter.com/i/status/1123997475856162821 …
Our military commanders have made it clear – failure to pass the #NDAA and the matching appropriations bill would be disastrous for military readiness and would endanger our men and women in uniform.

The $750 billion for defense spending in the Senate’s #NDAA bill and @realDonaldTrump’s budget request will build on recent progress to repair our industrial base, increase readiness, and reverse our military’s decline.

This week the Senate is considering the National Defense Authorization Act, a broadly bipartisan piece of legislation which will authorize the resources, equipment, and pay our troops need to remain the strongest fighting force in the world. #NDAA

I welcome the release of Mete Canturk. Now Erdogan should end all political prosecutions, including those of U.S. Consulate employees, journalists, & civil society actors. Hostage taking is not a pathway to diplomacy & the human rights of all Turkish citizens should be protected.

View my full statement on #DDay75 here ⤵  https://www.wicker.senate.gov/public/index.cfm/2019/6/wicker-commemorates-75th-anniversary-of-d-day-in-normandy … #DDay75thAnniversary
As the son of a World War II veteran who served in the European theatre, I am especially thankful for their sacrifice. Today, I join all Americans in honoring these heroes.
The men who fought, bled, and died here helped end Nazi tyranny in Europe and changed the course of world history. Their courage and devotion to duty will never be forgotten.

On the 75th Anniversary of D-Day, there is no place I would rather be than Normandy, where I can trace the footsteps of the thousands of American soldiers who stormed these beaches and began the liberation of a continent.
